page.title: 05RAILWAYS IN CARLISLE
page.content: The canal closed because the railways <quicker and cheaper>were taking over freight.In 1838,Carlisle's first rail- way was to Newcastle.In 1847,the Cita- del Station opened.In 1864,all six main railway companies were using Car- lisle station.In 1876,Victoria Viaduct opened as well as the Carlisle-Settle line.In 1880,the Citadel Station was enlarged and rebuilt at a cost of Â£379,135.In 1899,electric lights were installed in the station.In 1923,LMS and LNER took over the seven companies that ran into Carlisle.In 1948,only Kingmoor,Upperby,Durranhill and Canal Sheds were used for locomotives when the railways were nationalised.In 1963 the new Kingmoor marshalling yards opened.In 1968,the last steam service ran to Carlisle Station.In 1977,the present carriage and maintenance depot at Upperby was opened.
